title: Intermittent loss of hotkeys
body:
Periodically when the game starts I will be unable to use my hotkeys to level abilities, use abilities, use summoner spells, items, etc.  I used to be able to alt+f4 out and reload and it would fix it, but the last few times it has happened I have had to force quit over and over and it would eventually work on a reconnect.
Been going on off and on for years across two different computers, seemed to have resolved itself but is back.

Through light troubleshooting I thought it was related to tabbing out during the loading screen, but yesterday I had it happen in a game that I didn't touch anything at all during the load in.
I've found old forum posts about this and Rioters have recommended running league as admin (I do this anyways) and making sure no 3rd party programs are running.  I've seen people say it's got something to do with Steam, which I now make sure isn't running in the background.  I ran a repair last night just in case, and it happened the next game after.  

I don't know what else I can do to be completely sure this stops happening, it's getting pretty annoying having to level an ability in the fountain at the very start of the game to make sure my hotkeys work and having to alt f4 over and over to get it working.

replies.body:
It's possible that the settings files saved server-side are corrupt or misconfigured in some way. To ensure this isn't the case, I'd recommend completing a reset of the file with the following steps. First, you'll want to **log into the Client** then minimize it and navigate to your config folder, which should be in this directory:

>**C:\Riot Games\League of Legends\Config**

Delete these files:
**- input.ini
- PersistedSettings.json**

After deleting these two files, I'd like you to hop into a custom match so you can test if your key bindings will function properly now. Let me know if this worked!
Alright did that and everything seems fine for now, but like I said its an intermittent issue so I'll bump the thread if it happens again.  Thanks for the help.
